org.wonderly.url.vhttp
Class Handler

java.lang.Object
  java.net.URLStreamHandler
      org.wonderly.url.vhttp.Handler

public class Handler
extends URLStreamHandler

This is the protocol handler for the vhttp protocol. This protocol caches http:// requests in a local directory, and displays download progress if setParent() is called with a non-null frame. The caching directory is established using setCacheDir( dirName ) and is homed to System.getProperty("user.dir") if it is relative. If the caching directory is not set, no caching is done.

So, to use this in some java application, you need to do 

                if( System.getProperty("java.protocol.handler.pkgs") == null ) {
                        System.getProperties().put("java.protocol.handler.pkgs",
                                "org.wonderly.url");
                }
                JFrame top;
                ...
                // Set the parent frame for JDialog homing.
                org.wonderly.url.vhttp.Handler.setParent(top);
                // Set caching directory as 'cache' under the running directory.
                org.wonderly.url.vhttp.Handler.setCacheDir("cache");

The following properties are consulted in a static initializer

org.wonderly.vhttp.protocol
defaults to http
org.wonderly.vhttp.cache
defaults to no cache directory, which is null
org.wonderly.vhttp.debug
set to non-empty string enables debug logging using the org.wonderly.url.vhttp.Handler logger

Author:
Gregg Wonderly.
See Also:
setParent(JFrame), setCacheDir(String)
